name: The Westin Jersey City, Newport

reviews.text: This was my third hotel during my NYC trip (I like to check out different places when I travel). It lived up to the Westin brand and is brand new(open Mar 09). Great room, HD Tv, Heavenly Bed and Shower, quiet, pool, jacuzzi, fitness room, on-site restaurants. There is a small shopping mall right next door. Now here's the real plus for this hotel. The price is very good for a Big Name Brand because it isn't in NYC. But don't let that stop you. There is a PATH station within a block that will take you to lower Manhattan to Herald Square in about 15 minutes. From there you can connct to the New York subway/metro system. PATH runs 24/7 with reduced times on weekend nights/early morning(and did I see some characters during the early morning). Also, you can use NJ Transit/Long Island RR with PATH to get to this hotel really cheap, like about half of a shuttle and 70% of a taxi. Plus there's a NJ Light Rail station within a five minute walk that can take you various points along the Jersey side of the Hudson River. On top of that, Starwood currently offers a great military rate for this hotel. The only complaint I have is the internet isn't free. Why can't these "luxury" brands at least provide that seeing as lesser places make it part of the room?
reviews.title: What Can I Say...It's a Westin?

reviews.title: Great location, very clean and good value

reviews.text: Food in the hotel very good although a bit pricey but there are plenty of other options within walking distance.
reviews.title: We were treated like Royalty!

reviews.text: We picked this hotel for our 6 night stay (or rather, Priceline picked it for us) based on cost. The hotel is a comfortable place to stay, near Manhattan, but quiet even with the building construction outside between it and the Doubletree hotel. We stayed in two rooms on the 8th floor; one a king, the other two double beds.
reviews.title: Great value only minutes from Manhattan

reviews.text: Parking is available, both valet and in the adjacent Newport Mall. The Westin has a dedicated self-parking area in the mall parkade for $22/day. We left our van there for the duration of our stay and had no problems.
reviews.title: Supremely comfortable, and eco-friendly!

reviews.text: The 5-minute proximity to the PATH subway (Pavonia-Newport station) to Manhattan is a significant plus. We travelled by PATH daily to various points in Manhattan and it was convenient and inexpensive (a 10-ride QuickCard is $13). Many PATH stops are close to MTA subway stations. Bear in mind that weekend/late night service is less frequent than weekdays.
reviews.title: A good hotel with a few flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is 6-months new, and very clean throughout. The rooms are much larger than their equivalent in NYC. LCD TV received several Hi-def channels. The showers have a dual head and good water pressure. And the bedding was indeed heavenly. There were some minor service lapses, but nothing to get worked up about. Free daily USA Today newpapers, Wifi (in the lobby), and granny smith apples.
reviews.title: A little taste of heaven....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought the Westin was an excellent value overall, and would recommend this hotel for anyone who doesn't need to be in NYC proper.
reviews.title: Disorganized, the worst ever!

reviews.text: Yes, this is a Westin, which is to say, it has the corporate gloss and the subdued fabrics and the bright lobby, and the service people have that unctuous, robotically smiling manner. And the rooms are undeniably comfortable. But beneath that surface sheen, this is a hotel running on automatic pilot. When my room A/C fan would only run on high (too noisy for sleeping), the front desk dispatched an engineer, who fiddled with the digital panel, only to admit that, yes, this particular room's fan only seemed to run on high. He had no solution. So I had to turn off the A/C to sleep. When I used the lobby breakfast area, overly attentive servers kept swooping over to refill my coffee from carafes that dispensed coffee that wasn't nearly as hot as the main container only a few feet away. During the second 24 hours, the wireless connection was so slow, it took 1-3 minutes for a page to load. When I checked out, it took 45 minutes for the hotel to find a taxi, in the business heart of Jersey City on a relaxed Sunday morning, so I missed an earlier train I'd otherwise have caught, even as taxis whizzed by on the main boulevard. (And the vehicle they found, a private limo which I hadn't requested, cost me $15 more.) Though hotel employees always sprang into action, no one seemed particularly concerned if the service wasn't effective. Despite the showy attentiveness, this hotel feels oddly impersonal, as if it were a public relations exercise rather than an actual hotel. It promises, but doesn't fully deliver.
reviews.title: Reality check...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent stay, over July 4th weekend, was excellent in every way. Check-in was quick and friendly and bell service was swift. Self parking $22/night; valet $28. Our room was large and nicely appointed with pleasant decor and windows that opened a bit. Very comfortable bed and bedding. Meticulous housekeeping. Note that the site work has concluded at the construction area nearby, so no more pneumatic drills. Though work was being done during our visit, there was no noise.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay
Very Nice
reviews.text: We were most impressed with information available regarding nearby dining, the location of the Duane Reade (for water, soda, juice, etc. - available at the gift shop, with limited hours, within and pricey) within a five minute walk (you'd never notice it otherwise) and open late, the PATH station (across the street and up one block) and schedule and the Light Rail station (behind the hotel) and schedule, along with maps. Also nice was the detailed information regarding the July 4th fireworks, including a list of street closings and times in Manhattan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfast (rather reasonable prices) was set up on the bar in the cocktail lounge early each morning. Hot breakfast also available (pricey) in the dining room beyond, but mostly "healthy" choices (waffles, bacon, no pancakes). Quality of breakfast food was okay, but not outstanding, and a bit disappointing for the high prices (coffee $5, for example). Service was attentive and friendly, though.
reviews.title: Great Hotel that Could be Even Better
Between "Average" and "Very Good"
reviews.text: The area around the hotel is very nice (and was extremely peaceful and quiet over the holiday weekend) with the river just beyond a marina and office buildings across the road. Excellent for strolls, jogging...The large Newport Mall is right behind the hotel.

description: The Westin Jersey City Newport is close to Newark Liberty International Airport, Wall Street, Manhattan's World Financial Center, Greenwich Village; Union Square; Midtown Manhattan, and Times Square.
